raw: THE TRADE ORGANIZATIONS ACT, 2013 CONTENTS CHAPTER-I PRELIMINARY 1. Short title, extent, application and commencement 2. Definitions 3. Licensing and registration of trade organisations 4. Revocation of licences of existing trade organisations 5. Privileges and obligations of trade organisations 6. Renewal of licence 7. Cancellation of licence and exemption 8. Cancellation of registration 9. Grant of licence de novo 10. Membership of trade organisations 11. Organisation and tenure of office-bearers and executive committee of trade organisations 12. Uniformity in structure and autonomy of trade organizations 13. The Regulator 14. Powers and functions of the Regulator 15. Powers to enter and search the premises 16. Supersession of Executive Committee, office-bearers and appointment of Administrator 17. Administrator to act under control of the Regulator 18. Restriction on suits against trade organisations 19. Compulsory membership of trade organisations 20. Restriction on membership 21. Appeal 22. Delegation of powers 23. Federal Government may carry out functions of the Regulator 24. Power to levy fee etc. 25. Penalty 26. Contravention by companies, etc. 27. Trade Organisations Fund 28. Presumption as to orders 29. Mode of recovery 30. Indemnity 31. Power to make rules 32. Act to override other laws 33. Merger of trade organisations 34. Transitional provisions 35. Repeal and savings 36. Validation of actions etc. THE TRADE ORGANIZATIONS ACT, 2013 ACT No. II OF 2013 [20th February, 2013] An Act to provide for the registration and regulation of trade organizations WHEREAS it is expedient to ensure appropriate representation of all genders and business sectors at all levels in trade organizations and that they play significant role in developing policy framework for improving business environment and economic growthÍ¾ AND WHEREAS it is imperative to define the purpose, role, responsibilities and operational framework including code of corporate governance for trade organ
